titlestmt.titleproper: First Universalist Church of Brooklyn transcribed records 1973.255
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-08T14:56-0500

did.unittitle: First Universalist Church of Brooklyn transcribed records
did.abstract: This collection consists of typed copies of records of the First Universalist Church of Brooklyn, N.Y., spanning the period 1886 to 1938. The records include lists of church members and pastors, as well as lists of baptisms and deaths. An index of names is also included. The compiler of the records is unknown.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); First Universalist Church of Brooklyn transcribed records, 1973.255, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
